en: "But I am more powerful than the finger of a king," said the snake.
cn: “但我比一个国王的手指更有威力。”蛇说道。

en: The little prince smiled.
cn: 小王子微笑着说：

en: "You are not very powerful. You haven't even any feet. You cannot even travel..."
cn: “你并不那么有威力……你连脚都没有……你甚至都不能旅行…”

en: "I can carry you farther than any ship could take you," said the snake.
cn: “我可以把你带到很远的地方去，比一只船能去的地方还要远。”蛇说道。

en: He twined himself around the little prince's ankle, like a golden bracelet.
cn: 蛇就盘结在小王子的脚腕子上，象一只金镯子。

en: "Whomever I touch, I send back to the earth from whence he came," the snake spoke again. "But you are innocent and true, and you come from a star..."
cn: “被我碰触的人，我就把他送回老家去。”蛇还说，“可是你是纯洁的，而且是从另一个星球上来的…”

en: The little prince made no reply.
cn: 小王子什么也没有回答。

en: "You move me to pity-- you are so weak on this Earth made of granite," the snake said. "I can help you, some day, if you grow too homesick for your own planet. I can--"
cn: “在这个花岗石的地球上，你这么弱小，我很可怜你。如果你非常怀念你的星球，那时我可以帮助你。我可以…”

en: "Oh! I understand you very well," said the little prince. "But why do you always speak in riddles?"
cn: “啊！我很明白你的意思。”小王子说，“但是你为什么说话总是象让人猜谜语似的？”

en: "I solve them all," said the snake.
cn: “这些谜语我都能解开的。”蛇说。

en: And they were both silent.
cn: 于是他们又都沉默起来。

en: - the little prince goes looking for men and meets a flower
The little prince crossed the desert and met with only one flower. It was a flower with three petals, a flower of no account at all.
cn: 小王子穿过沙漠。他只见过一朵花，一个有着三枚花瓣的花朵，一朵很不起眼的小花…

en: "Good morning," said the little prince.
cn: “你好。”小王子说。

en: "Good morning," said the flower.
cn: “你好。”花说。

en: "Where are the men?" the little prince asked, politely.
cn: “人在什么地方？”小王子有礼貌地问道。

en: The flower had once seen a caravan passing.
cn: 有一天，花曾看见一支骆驼商队走过：

en: "Men?" she echoed. "I think there are six or seven of them in existence. I saw them, several years ago. But one never knows where to find them. The wind blows them away. They have no roots, and that makes their life very difficult."
cn: “人吗？我想大约有六七个人，几年前，我瞅见过他们。可是，从来不知道到什么地方去找他们。风吹着他们到处跑。他们没有根，这对他们来说是很不方便的。”

en: "Goodbye," said the little prince.
cn: “再见了。”小王子说。

en: "Goodbye," said the flower.
cn: “再见。”花说。

en: - the little prince climbs a mountain range

After that, the little prince climbed a high mountain. The only mountains he had ever known were the three volcanoes, which came up to his knees. And he used the extinct volcano as a footstool. "From a mountain as high as this one," he said to himself, "I shall be able to see the whole planet at one glance, and all the people..."
cn: 小王子爬上一座高山。过去他所见过的山就是那三座只有他膝盖那么高的火山，并且他把那座熄灭了的火山就当作凳子。小王子自言自语地说道：“从这么高的山上，我一眼可以看到整个星球，以及所有的人。”

en: But he saw nothing, save peaks of rock that were sharpened like needles.
cn: 可是，他所看到的只是一些非常锋利的悬崖峭壁。

en: "Good morning," he said courteously.
cn: “你好。”小王子试探地问道。

en: "Good morning--Good morning--Good morning," answered the echo.
cn: “你好…你好…你好…”回音在回答道。

en: "Who are you?" said the little prince.
cn: “你们是什么人？”小王子问。

en: "Who are you--Who are you--Who are you?" answered the echo.
cn: “你们是什么人…你们是什么人…你们是什么人…”回音又回答道。

en: "Be my friends. I am all alone," he said.
cn: “请你们做我的朋友吧，我很孤独。”他说。

en: "I am all alone--all alone--all alone," answered the echo.
cn: “我很孤独…我很孤独…我很孤独…”回音又回答着。

en: "What a queer planet!" he thought. "It is altogether dry, and altogether pointed, and altogether harsh and forbidding. And the people have no imagination. They repeat whatever one says to them... On my planet I had a flower; she always was the first to speak..."
cn: 小王子想道：“这颗行星真奇怪！它上面全是干巴巴的，而且又尖利又咸涩，人们一点想象力都没有。他们只是重复别人对他们说的话…在我的家乡，我有一朵花。她总是自己先说话…”

en: - the little prince discovers a garden of roses
But it happened that after walking for a long time through sand, and rocks, and snow, the little prince at last came upon a road. And all roads lead to the abodes of men.
cn: 在沙漠、岩石、雪地上行走了很长的时间以后，小王子终于发现了一条大路。所有的大路都是通往人住的地方的。

en: "Good morning," he said.
cn: “你们好。”小王子说。

en: He was standing before a garden, all a-bloom with roses.
cn: 这是一个玫瑰盛开的花园。

en: "Good morning," said the roses.
cn: “你好。”玫瑰花说道。

en: The little prince gazed at them. They all looked like his flower.
cn: 小王子瞅着这些花，它们全都和他的那朵花一样。

en: "Who are you?" he demanded, thunderstruck.
cn: “你们是什么花？”小王子惊奇地问。

en: "We are roses," the roses said.
cn: “我们是玫瑰花。”花儿们说道。

en: And he was overcome with sadness. His flower had told him that she was the only one of her kind in all the universe. And here were five thousand of them, all alike, in one single garden!
cn: 他感到自己非常不幸。他的那朵花曾对他说她是整个宇宙中独一无二的一种花。可是，仅在这一座花园里就有五千朵完全一样的这种花朵！

en: "She would be very much annoyed," he said to himself, "if she should see that... she would cough most dreadfully, and she would pretend that she was dying, to avoid being laughed at. And I should be obliged to pretend that I was nursing her back to life-- for if I did not do that, to humble myself also, she would really allow herself to die..."
cn: 小王子自言自语地说：“如果她看到这些，她是一定会很恼火…她会咳嗽得更厉害，并且为避免让人耻笑，她会佯装死去。那么，我还得装着去护理她，因为如果不这样的话，她为了使我难堪，她可能会真的死去…”

en: Then he went on with his reflections: "I thought that I was rich, with a flower that was unique in all the world; and all I had was a common rose. A common rose, and three volcanoes that come up to my knees-- and one of them perhaps extinct forever... that doesn't make me a very great prince..."
cn: 接着他又说道：“我还以为我有一朵独一无二的花呢，我有的仅是一朵普通的花。这朵花，再加上三座只有我膝盖那么高的火山，而且其中一座还可能是永远熄灭了的，这一切不会使我成为一个了不起的王子…”

en: And he lay down in the grass and cried.
cn: 于是，他躺在草丛中哭泣起来。

en: - the little prince befriends the fox
It was then that the fox appeared.
cn: 就在这当儿，跑来了一只狐狸。

en: "Good morning," said the fox.
cn: “你好。”狐狸说。

en: "Good morning," the little prince responded politely, although when he turned around he saw nothing.
cn: “你好。”小王子很有礼貌地回答道。他转过身来，但什么也没有看到。

en: "I am right here," the voice said, "under the apple tree."
cn: “我在这儿，在苹果树下。”那声音说。

en: "Who are you?" asked the little prince, and added, "You are very pretty to look at."
cn: “你是谁？”小王子说，“你很漂亮。”

en: "I am a fox," said the fox.
cn: “我是一只狐狸。”狐狸说。

en: "Come and play with me," proposed the little prince. "I am so unhappy."
cn: “来和我一起玩吧，”小王子建议道，“我很苦恼…”

en: "I cannot play with you," the fox said. "I am not tamed."
cn: “我不能和你一起玩，”狐狸说，“我还没有被驯服呢。”

en: "Ah! Please excuse me," said the little prince.
cn: “啊！真对不起。”小王子说。

en: But, after some thought, he added:
cn: 思索了一会儿，他又说道：

en: "What does that mean-- 'tame'?"
cn: “什么叫‘驯服’呀？”

en: "You do not live here," said the fox. "What is it that you are looking for?"
cn: “你不是此地人。”狐狸说，“你来寻找什么？”

en: "I am looking for men," said the little prince. "What does that mean-- 'tame'?"
cn: “我来找人。”小王子说，“什么叫‘驯服’呢？”

en: "Men," said the fox. "They have guns, and they hunt. It is very disturbing. They also raise chickens. These are their only interests. Are you looking for chickens?"
cn: “人，”狐狸说，“他们有枪，他们还打猎，这真碍事！他们唯一的可取之处就是他们也养鸡，你是来寻找鸡的吗？”

en: "No," said the little prince. "I am looking for friends. What does that mean-- 'tame'?"
cn: “不，”小王子说，“我是来找朋友的。什么叫‘驯服’呢？”

en: "It is an act too often neglected," said the fox. It means to establish ties."
cn: “这是已经早就被人遗忘了的事情，”狐狸说，“它的意思就是‘建立联系’。”

en: "'To establish ties'?"
cn: “建立联系？”

en: "Just that," said the fox. "To me, you are still nothing more than a little boy who is just like a hundred thousand other little boys. And I have no need of you. And you, on your part, have no need of me. To you, I am nothing more than a fox like a hundred thousand other foxes. But if you tame me, then we shall need each other. To me, you will be unique in all the world. To you, I shall be unique in all the world..."
cn: “一点不错，”狐狸说。“对我来说，你还只是一个小男孩，就像其他千万个小男孩一样。我不需要你。你也同样用不着我。对你来说，我也不过是一只狐狸，和其他千万只狐狸一样。但是，如果你驯服了我，我们就互相不可缺少了。对我来说，你就是世界上唯一的了；我对你来说，也是世界上唯一的了。”

en: "I am beginning to understand," said the little prince. "There is a flower... I think that she has tamed me..."
cn: “我有点明白了。”小王子说，“有一朵花…，我想，她把我驯服了…”

en: "It is possible," said the fox. "On the Earth one sees all sorts of things."
cn: “这是可能的。”狐狸说，“世界上什么样的事都可能看到…”

en: "Oh, but this is not on the Earth!" said the little prince.
cn: “啊，这不是在地球上的事。”小王子说。

en: The fox seemed perplexed, and very curious.
cn: 狐狸感到十分蹊跷。

en: "On another planet?"
cn: “在另一个星球上？”

en: "Yes."
cn: “是的。”

en: "Are there hunters on this planet?"
cn: “在那个星球上，有猎人吗？”

en: "No."
cn: “没有。”

en: "Ah, that is interesting! Are there chickens?"
cn: “这很有意思。那么，有鸡吗？”

en: "No."
cn: “没有。”

en: "Nothing is perfect," sighed the fox.
cn: “没有十全十美的。”狐狸叹息地说道。

en: But he came back to his idea.
cn: 可是，狐狸又把话题拉回来：

en: "My life is very monotonous," the fox said. "I hunt chickens; men hunt me. All the chickens are just alike, and all the men are just alike. And, in consequence, I am a little bored. But if you tame me, it will be as if the sun came to shine on my life . I shall know the sound of a step that will be different from all the others. Other steps send me hurrying back underneath the ground. Yours will call me, like music, out of my burrow. And then look: you see the grain-fields down yonder? I do not ea t bread. Wheat is of no use to me. The wheat fields have nothing to say to me. And that is sad. But you have hair that is the colour of gold. Think how wonderful that will be when you have tamed me! The grain, which is also golden, will bring me bac k the thought of you. And I shall love to listen to the wind in the wheat..."
cn: “我的生活很单调。我捕捉鸡，而人又捕捉我。所有的鸡全都一样，所有的人也全都一样。因此，我感到有些厌烦了。但是，如果你要是驯服了我，我的生活就一定会是欢快的。我会辨认出一种与众不同的脚步声。其他的脚步声会使我躲到地下去，而你的脚步声就会象音乐一样让我从洞里走出来。再说，你看！你看到那边的麦田没有？我不吃面包，麦子对我来说，一点用也没有。我对麦田无动于衷。而这，真使人扫兴。但是，你有着金黄色的头发。那么，一旦你驯服了我，这就会十分美妙。麦子，是金黄色的，它就会使我想起你。而且，我甚至会喜欢那风吹麦浪的声音…”

en: The fox gazed at the little prince, for a long time.
cn: 狐狸沉默不语，久久地看着小王子。

en: "Please-- tame me!" he said.
cn: “请你驯服我吧！”他说。

en: "I want to, very much," the little prince replied. "But I have not much time. I have friends to discover, and a great many things to understand."
cn: “我是很愿意的。”小王子回答道，“可我的时间不多了。我还要去寻找朋友，还有许多事物要了解。”

en: "One only understands the things that one tames," said the fox. "Men have no more time to understand anything. They buy things all ready made at the shops. But there is no shop anywhere where one can buy friendship, and so men have no friends any more. If you want a friend, tame me..."
cn: “只有被驯服了的事物，才会被了解。”狐狸说，“人不会再有时间去了解任何东西的。他们总是到商人那里去购买现成的东西。因为世界上还没有购买朋友的商店，所以人也就没有朋友。如果你想要一个朋友，那就驯服我吧！”

en: "What must I do, to tame you?" asked the little prince.
cn: “那么应当做些什么呢？”小王子说。

en: "You must be very patient," replied the fox. "First you will sit down at a little distance from me-- like that-- in the grass. I shall look at you out of the corner of my eye, and you will say nothing. Words are the source of misunderstandings. But yo u will sit a little closer to me, every day..."
cn: “应当非常耐心。”狐狸回答道，“开始你就这样坐在草丛中，坐得离我稍微远些。我用眼角瞅着你，你什么也不要说。话语是误会的根源。但是，每天，你坐得靠我更近些…”

en: The next day the little prince came back.
cn: 第二天，小王子又来了。

en: "It would have been better to come back at the same hour," said the fox. "If, for example, you come at four o'clock in the afternoon, then at three o'clock I shall begin to be happy. I shall feel happier and happier as the hour advances. At four o'clock, I shall already be worrying and jumping about. I shall show you how happy I am! But if you come at just any time, I shall never know at what hour my heart is to be ready to greet you... One must observe the proper rites..."
cn: “最好还是在原来的那个时间来。”狐狸说道，“比如说，你下午四点钟来，那么从三点钟起，我就开始感到幸福。时间越临近，我就越感到幸福。到了四点钟的时候，我就会坐立不安；我就会发现幸福的代价。但是，如果你随便什么时候来，我就不知道在什么时候该准备好我的心情…应当有一定的仪式。”

en: "What is a rite?" asked the little prince.
cn: “仪式是什么？”小王子问道。

en: "Those also are actions too often neglected," said the fox. "They are what make one day different from other days, one hour from other hours. There is a rite, for example, among my hunters. Every Thursday they dance with the village girls. So Thursday is a wonderful day for me! I can take a walk as far as the vineyards. But if the hunters danced at just any time, every day would be like every other day, and I should never have any vacation at all."
cn: “这也是一种早已被人忘却了的事。”狐狸说，“它就是使某一天与其他日子不同，使某一时刻与其他时刻不同。比如说，我的那些猎人就有一种仪式。他们每星期四都和村子里的姑娘们跳舞。于是，星期四就是一个美好的日子！我可以一直散步到葡萄园去。如果猎人们什么时候都跳舞，天天又全都一样，那么我也就没有假日了。”

en: So the little prince tamed the fox. And when the hour of his departure drew near--
cn: 就这样，小王子驯服了狐狸。当出发的时刻就快要来到时：

en: "Ah," said the fox, "I shall cry."
cn: “啊！”狐狸说，“我一定会哭的。”

en: "It is your own fault," said the little prince. "I never wished you any sort of harm; but you wanted me to tame you..."
cn: “这是你的过错，”小王子说，“我本来并不想给你任何痛苦，可你却要我驯服你…”

en: "Yes, that is so," said the fox.
cn: “是这样的。”狐狸说。

en: "But now you are going to cry!" said the little prince.
cn: “你可就要哭了！”小王子说。

en: "Yes, that is so," said the fox.
cn: “当然咯。”狐狸说。

en: "Then it has done you no good at all!"
cn: “那么你什么好处也没得到。”

en: "It has done me good," said the fox, "because of the color of the wheat fields." And then he added:
cn: “由于麦子颜色的缘故，我还是得到了好处。”狐狸说。然后，他又接着说。

en: "Go and look again at the roses. You will understand now that yours is unique in all the world. Then come back to say goodbye to me, and I will make you a present of a secret."
cn: “再去看看那些玫瑰花吧。你一定会明白，你的那朵是世界上独一无二的玫瑰。你回来和我告别时，我再赠送给你一个秘密。”

en: The little prince went away, to look again at the roses.
cn: 于是小王子又去看那些玫瑰。

en: "You are not at all like my rose," he said. "As yet you are nothing. No one has tamed you, and you have tamed no one. You are like my fox when I first knew him. He was only a fox like a hundred thousand other foxes. But I have made him my friend, and now he is unique in all the world."
cn: “你们一点也不象我的那朵玫瑰，你们还什么都不是呢！”小王子对她们说。“没有人驯服过你们，你们也没有驯服过任何人。你们就象我的狐狸过去那样，它那时只是和千万只别的狐狸一样的一只狐狸。但是，我现在已经把它当成了我的朋友，于是它现在就是世界上独一无二的了。”

en: And the roses were very much embarrassed.
cn: 这时，那些玫瑰花显得十分难堪。

en: "You are beautiful, but you are empty," he went on. "One could not die for you. To be sure, an ordinary passerby would think that my rose looked just like you-- the rose that belongs to me. But in herself alone she is more important than all the hundreds of you other roses: because it is she that I have watered; because it is she that I have put under the glass globe; because it is she that I have sheltered behind the screen; because it is for her that I have killed the caterpillars (except the two or three that we saved to become butterflies); because it is she that I have listened to, when she grumbled, or boasted, or even sometimes when she said nothing. Because she is my rose.
cn: “你们很美，但你们是空虚的。”小王子仍然在对她们说，“没有人能为你们去死。当然罗，我的那朵玫瑰花，一个普通的过路人以为她和你们一样。可是，她单独一朵就比你们全体更重要，因为她是我浇灌的。因为她是我放在花罩中的。因为她是我用屏风保护起来的。因为她身上的毛虫（除了留下两三只为了变蝴蝶而外）是我除灭的。因为我倾听过她的怨艾和自诩，甚至有时我聆听着她的沉默。因为她是我的玫瑰。”

en: And he went back to meet the fox.
cn: 他又回到了狐狸身边。

en: "Goodbye," he said.
cn: “再见了。”小王子说道。

en: "Goodbye," said the fox. "And now here is my secret, a very simple secret: It is only with the heart that one can see rightly; what is essential is invisible to the eye."
cn: “再见。”狐狸说。“喏，这就是我的秘密。很简单：只有用心才能看得清。实质性的东西，用眼睛是看不见的。”

en: "What is essential is invisible to the eye," the little prince repeated, so that he would be sure to remember.
cn: “实质性的东西，用眼睛是看不见的。”小王子重复着这句话，以便能把它记在心间。

en: "It is the time you have wasted for your rose that makes your rose so important."
cn: “正因为你为你的玫瑰花费了时间，这才使你的玫瑰变得如此重要。”

en: "It is the time I have wasted for my rose--" said the little prince, so that he would be sure to remember.
cn: “正因为你为你的玫瑰花费了时间…”小王子又重复着，要使自己记住这些。

en: "Men have forgotten this truth," said the fox. "But you must not forget it. You become responsible, forever, for what you have tamed. You are responsible for your rose..."
cn: “人们已经忘记了这个道理，”狐狸说，“可是，你不应该忘记它。你现在要对你驯服过的一切负责到底。你要对你的玫瑰负责…”

en: "I am responsible for my rose," the little prince repeated, so that he would be sure to remember.
cn: “我要对我的玫瑰负责…”小王子又重复着……

en: - the little prince encounters a railway switchman
"Good morning," said the little prince.
cn: “你好。”小王子说道。

en: "Good morning," said the railway switchman.
cn: “你好。”扳道工说道。

en: "What do you do here?" the little prince asked.
cn: “你在这里做什么？”小王子问。

en: "I sort out travelers, in bundles of a thousand," said the switchman. "I send off the trains that carry them; now to the right, now to the left."
cn: “我一包包地分选旅客，按每千人一包。”扳道工说，“我打发这些运载旅客的列车，一会儿发往右方，一会儿发往左方。”

en: And a brilliantly lighted express train shook the switchman's cabin as it rushed by with a roar like thunder.
cn: 这时，一列灯火明亮的快车，雷鸣般地响着，把扳道房震得颤颤悠悠。

en: "They are in a great hurry," said the little prince. "What are they looking for?"
cn: “他们真匆忙呀，”小王子说，“他们要寻找什么？”

en: "Not even the locomotive engineer knows that," said the switchman.
cn: “开机车的人自己也不知道。”扳道工说道。

en: And a second brilliantly lighted express thundered by, in the opposite direction.
cn: 于是，第二列灯火通明的快车又朝着相反的方向轰隆轰隆地开过去。

en: "Are they coming back already?" demanded the little prince.
cn: “他们怎么又回来了呢？”小王子问道。

en: "These are not the same ones," said the switchman. "It is an exchange."
cn: “他们不是原来那些人了。”扳道工说，“这是一次对开列车。”

en: "Were they not satisfied where they were?" asked the little prince.
cn: “他们不满意他们原来所住的地方吗？”

en: "No one is ever satisfied where he is," said the switchman.
cn: “人们是从来也不会满意自己所在的地方的。”扳道工说。

en: And they heard the roaring thunder of a third brilliantly lighted express.
cn: 此时，第三趟灯火明亮的快车又隆隆而过。

en: "Are they pursuing the first travelers?" demanded the little prince.
cn: “他们是在追随第一批旅客吗？”小王子问道。

en: "They are pursuing nothing at all," said the switchman. "They are asleep in there, or if they are not asleep they are yawning. Only the children are flattening their noses against the windowpanes."
cn: “他们什么也不追随。”扳道工说，“他们在里面睡觉，或是在打哈欠。只有孩子们把鼻子贴在玻璃窗上往外看。”

en: "Only the children know what they are looking for," said the little prince. "They waste their time over a rag doll and it becomes very important to them; and if anybody takes it away from them, they cry..."
cn: “只有孩子知道他们自己在寻找什么。”小王子说，“他们为一个布娃娃花费不少时间，这个布娃娃就成了很重要的东西，如果有人夺走的他们的布娃娃，他们就哭泣…”

en: "They are lucky," the switchman said.
cn: “他们真幸运。”扳道工说。

en: - the little prince encounters a merchant
"Good morning," said the little prince.
cn: “你好。”小王子说。

en: "Good morning," said the merchant.
cn: “你好。”商人说道。

en: This was a merchant who sold pills that had been invented to quench thirst. You need only swallow one pill a week, and you would feel no need of anything to drink.
cn: 这是一位贩卖能够止渴的精制药丸的商人。每周吞服一丸就不会感觉口渴。

en: "Why are you selling those?" asked the little prince.
cn: “你为什么卖这玩艺儿？”小王子说。

en: "Because they save a tremendous amount of time," said the merchant. "Computations have been made by experts. With these pills, you save fifty-three minutes in every week."
cn: “这就大大地节约了时间。”商人说，“专家们计算过，这样，每周可以节约五十三分钟。”

en: "And what do I do with those fifty-three minutes?"
cn: “那么，用这五十三分钟做什么用？”

en: "Anything you like..."
cn: “随便怎么用都行。…”

en: "As for me," said the little prince to himself, "if I had fifty-three minutes to spend as I liked, I should walk at my leisure toward a spring of fresh water."
cn: 小王子自言自语地说：“我如果有五十三分钟可支配，我就悠哉游哉地向水泉走去…”

en: - the narrator and the little prince, thirsty, hunt for a well in the desert
It was now the eighth day since I had had my accident in the desert, and I had listened to the story of the merchant as I was drinking the last drop of my water supply.
cn: 这是我在沙漠上出了事故的第八天。我听着有关这个商人的故事，喝完了我所备用的最后一滴水。

en: "Ah," I said to the little prince, "these memories of yours are very charming; but I have not yet succeeded in repairing my plane; I have nothing more to drink; and I, too, should be very happy if I could walk at my leisure toward a spring of fresh water!"
cn: “啊！”我对小王子说，“你回忆的这些故事真美。可是，我还没有修好我的飞机。我没有喝的了，假如我能悠哉游哉地走到水泉边去，我一定也会很高兴的！”

en: "My friend the fox--" the little prince said to me.
cn: 小王子对我说：“我的朋友狐狸…”

en: "My dear little man, this is no longer a matter that has anything to do with the fox!"
cn: “我的小家伙，现在还说什么狐狸！”

en: "Why not?"
cn: “为什么？”

en: "Because I am about to die of thirst..."
cn: “因为这就要渴死人了。”

en: He did not follow my reasoning, and he answered me:
cn: 他不理解我的思路，他回答我道：

en: "It is a good thing to have had a friend, even if one is about to die. I, for instance, am very glad to have had a fox as a friend..."
cn: “即使快要死了，有过一个朋友也好么！我就为我有过一个狐狸朋友而感到很高兴…”

en: "He has no way of guessing the danger," I said to myself. "He has never been either hungry or thirsty. A little sunshine is all he needs..."
cn: “他不顾危险。”我自己思量着，“他从来不知道饥渴。只要有点阳光，他就满足了…”

en: But he looked at me steadily, and replied to my thought:
cn: 他看着我，答复着我的思想：

en: "I am thirsty, too. Let us look for a well..."
cn: “我也渴了…我们去找一口井吧…”

en: I made a gesture of weariness. It is absurd to look for a well, at random, in the immensity of the desert. But nevertheless we started walking.
cn: 我显出厌烦的样子：在茫茫的大沙漠上盲目地去找水井，真荒唐。然而我们还是开始去寻找了。

en: When we had trudged along for several hours, in silence, the darkness fell, and the stars began to come out. Thirst had made me a little feverish, and I looked at them as if I were in a dream. The little prince's last words came reeling back into my memory:
cn: 当我们默默地走了好几个小时以后，天黑了下来，星星开始发出光亮。由于渴我有点发烧，我看着这些星星，象是在做梦一样。小王子的话在我的脑海中跳来跳去。

en: "Then you are thirsty, too?" I demanded.
cn: “你也渴吗？”我问他。

en: But he did not reply to my question. He merely said to me:
cn: 他却不回答我的问题，只是对我说：

en: "Water may also be good for the heart..."
cn: “水对心也是有益处的…”

en: I did not understand this answer, but I said nothing. I knew very well that it was impossible to cross-examine him.
cn: 我不懂他的话是什么意思，可我也不做声…我知道不应该去问他。

en: He was tired. He sat down. I sat down beside him. And, after a little silence, he spoke again:
cn: 他累了，他坐下来。我在他身旁坐下。沉默了一会，他又说道：

en: "The stars are beautiful, because of a flower that cannot be seen."
cn: “星星是很美的，因为有一朵人们看不到的花…”

en: I replied, "Yes, that is so." And, without saying anything more, I looked across the ridges of sand that were stretched out before us in the moonlight.
cn: 我回答道：“当然。”而我默默地看着月光下沙漠的褶皱。

en: "The desert is beautiful," the little prince added.
cn: “沙漠是美的。”他又说道。

en: And that was true. I have always loved the desert. One sits down on a desert sand dune, sees nothing, hears nothing. Yet through the silence something throbs, and gleams...
cn: 确实如此。我一直很喜欢沙漠。坐在一个沙丘上，什么也看不见、听不见。但是，却有一种说不出的东西在默默地放着光芒…

en: "What makes the desert beautiful," said the little prince, "is that somewhere it hides a well..."
cn: “使沙漠更加美丽的，就是在某个角落里，藏着一口井…”

en: I was astonished by a sudden understanding of that mysterious radiation of the sands. When I was a little boy I lived in an old house, and legend told us that a treasure was buried there. To be sure, no one had ever known how to find it; perhaps no one had ever even looked for it. But it cast an enchantment over that house. My home was hiding a secret in the depths of its heart...
cn: 我很惊讶，突然明白了为什么沙漠放着光芒。当我还是一个小孩子的时候，我住在一座古老的房子里，而且传说，这个房子里埋藏着一个宝贝。当然，从来没有任何人能发现这个宝贝，可能，甚至也没有人去寻找过。但是，这个宝贝使整个房子着了魔似的。我家的房子在它的心灵深处隐藏着一个秘密…

en: "Yes," I said to the little prince. "The house, the stars, the desert-- what gives them their beauty is something that is invisible!"
cn: 我对小王子说道：“是的，无论是房子，星星，或是沙漠，使它们美丽的东西是看不见的！”

en: "I am glad," he said, "that you agree with my fox."
cn: “我真高兴，你和我的狐狸的看法一样。”小王子说。

en: As the little prince dropped off to sleep, I took him in my arms and set out walking once more. I felt deeply moved, and stirred. It seemed to me that I was carrying a very fragile treasure. It seemed to me, even, that there was nothing more fragile on all Earth. In the moonlight I looked at his pale forehead, his closed eyes, his locks of hair that trembled in the wind, and I said to myself: "What I see here is nothing but a shell. What is most important is invisible..."
cn: 小王子睡觉了，我就把他抱在怀里，又重新上路了。我很激动。就好象抱着一个脆弱的宝贝。就好象在地球上没有比这更脆弱的了。我借着月光看着这惨白的面额，这双紧闭的眼睛，这随风飘动的绺绺头发，这时我对自己说道：“我所看到的仅仅是外表。最重要的是看不见的…”

en: As his lips opened slightly with the suspicious of a half-smile, I said to myself, again: "What moves me so deeply, about this little prince who is sleeping here, is his loyalty to a flower-- the image of a rose that shines through his whole being like the flame of a lamp, even when he is asleep..." And I felt him to be more fragile still. I felt the need of protecting him, as if he himself were a flame that might be extinguished by a little puff of wind...
cn: 由于看到他稍稍张开的嘴唇露出一丝微笑，我又自言自语地说：“在这个熟睡了的小王子身上，使我非常感动的，是他对他那朵花的忠诚，是在他心中闪烁的那朵玫瑰花的形象。这朵玫瑰花，即使在小王子睡着了的时候，也象一盏灯的火焰一样在他身上闪耀着光辉…”这时，我就感觉到他更加脆弱。应该保护灯焰：一阵风就可能把它吹灭…

en: And, as I walked on so, I found the well, at daybreak.
cn: 于是，就这样走着，我在黎明时发现了水井。

en: - finding a well, the narrator and the little prince discuss his return to his planet
"Men," said the little prince, "set out on their way in express trains, but they do not know what they are looking for. Then they rush about, and get excited, and turn round and round..."
cn: “那些人们，他们往快车里拥挤，但是他们却不知道要寻找什么。于是，他们就忙忙碌碌，来回转圈子…”小王子说道。

en: And he added:
cn: 他接着又说：

en: "It is not worth the trouble..."
cn: “这没有必要…”

en: The well that we had come to was not like the wells of the Sahara. The wells of the Sahara are mere holes dug in the sand. This one was like a well in a village. But there was no village here, and I thought I must be dreaming...
cn: 我们终于找到的这口井，不同于撒哈拉的那些井。撒哈拉的井只是沙漠中挖的洞。这口井则很象村子中的井。可是，那里又没有任何村庄，我还以为是在做梦呢。

en: "It is strange," I said to the little prince. "Everything is ready for use: the pulley, the bucket, the rope..."
cn: “真怪，”我对小王子说：“一切都是现成的：辘轳、水桶、绳子…”

en: He laughed, touched the rope, and set the pulley to working. And the pulley moaned, like an old weathervane which the wind has long since forgotten.
cn: 他笑了，拿着绳子，转动着辘轳。辘轳就象是一个长期没有风来吹动的旧风标一样，吱吱作响。

en: "Do you hear?" said the little prince. "We have wakened the well, and it is singing..."
cn: “你听，”小王子说：“我们唤醒了这口井，它现在唱起歌来了…”

en: I did not want him to tire himself with the rope.
cn: 我不愿让他费劲。我对他说：

en: "Leave it to me," I said. "It is too heavy for you."
cn: “让我来干吧。这活对你太重了。”

en: I hoisted the bucket slowly to the edge of the well and set it there-- happy, tired as I was, over my achievement. The song of the pulley was still in my ears, and I could see the sunlight shimmer in the still trembling water.
cn: 我慢慢地把水桶提到井栏上。我把它稳稳地放在那里。我的耳朵里还响着辘轳的歌声。依然还在晃荡的水面上，我看见太阳的影子在跳动。

en: "I am thirsty for this water," said the little prince. "Give me some of it to drink..."
cn: “我正需要喝这种水。”小王子说：“给我喝点…”

en: And I understood what he had been looking for.
cn: 这时我才明白了他所要寻找的是什么！

en: I raised the bucket to his lips. He drank, his eyes closed. It was as sweet as some special festival treat. This water was indeed a different thing from ordinary nourishment. Its sweetness was born of the walk under the stars, the song of the pulley, the effort of my arms. It was good for the heart, like a present. When I was a little boy, the lights of the Christmas tree, the music of the Midnight Mass, the tenderness of smiling faces, used to make up, so, the radiance of the gifts I received.
cn: 我把水桶提到他的嘴边。他闭着眼睛喝水。就象节日一般舒适愉快。这水远不只是一种饮料，它是披星戴月走了许多路才找到的，是在辘轳的歌声中，经过我双臂的努力得来的。它象是一件礼品慰藉着心田。在我小的时候，圣诞树的灯光，午夜的弥撒的音乐，甜蜜的微笑，这一切都使圣诞节时我收到的礼品辉映着幸福的光彩。

en: "The men where you live," said the little prince, "raise five thousand roses in the same garden-- and they do not find in it what they are looking for."
cn: “你这里的人在同一个花园中种植着五千朵玫瑰。”小王子说：“可是，他们却不能从中找到自己所要寻找的东西…”

en: "They do not find it," I replied.
cn: “他们是找不到的。”我回答道。

en: "And yet what they are looking for could be found in one single rose, or in a little water."
cn: “然而，他们所寻找的东西却是可以从一朵玫瑰花或一点儿水中找到的…”

en: "Yes, that is true," I said.
cn: “一点不错。”我回答道。

en: And the little prince added:
cn: 小王子又加了一句：

en: "But the eyes are blind. One must look with the heart..."
cn: “眼睛是什么也看不见的。应该用心去寻找。”

en: I had drunk the water. I breathed easily. At sunrise the sand is the color of honey. And that honey color was making me happy, too. What brought me, then, this sense of grief?
cn: 我喝了水。我痛快地呼吸着空气。沙漠在晨曦中泛出蜂蜜的光泽。这蜂蜜般的光泽也使我感到幸福。为什么我要难过…

en: "You must keep your promise," said the little prince, softly, as he sat down beside me once more.
cn: 小王子又重新在我的身边坐下。他温柔地对我说：“你应该实践你的诺言。”

en: "What promise?"
cn: “什么诺言？”

en: "You know-- a muzzle for my sheep... I am responsible for this flower..."
cn: “你知道…给我的小羊一个嘴套子…我要对我的花负责的呀！”

en: I took my rough drafts of drawings out of my pocket. The little prince looked them over, and laughed as he said:
cn: 我从口袋中拿出我的画稿。小王子瞅见了，笑着说：

en: "Your baobabs-- they look a little like cabbages."
cn: “你画的猴面包树，有点象白菜…”

en: "Oh!"
I had been so proud of my baobabs!
cn: 我还为我画的猴面包树感到骄傲呢！

en: "Your fox-- his ears look a little like horns; and they are too long."
cn: “你画的狐狸…它那双耳朵…有点象犄角…而且又太长了！”

en: And he laughed again.
cn: 这时，他又笑了。

en: "You are not fair, little prince," I said. "I don't know how to draw anything except boa constrictors from the outside and boa constrictors from the inside."
cn: “小家伙，你太不公正了。我过去只会画开着肚皮和闭着肚皮的巨蟒。”

en: "Oh, that will be all right," he said, "children understand."
cn: “啊！这就行了。”他说：“孩子们认得出来。”

en: So then I made a pencil sketch of a muzzle. And as I gave it to him my heart was torn.
cn: 我就用铅笔勾画了一个嘴套。当我把它递给小王子时，我心里很难受：

en: "You have plans that I do not know about," I said.
cn: “你的打算，我一点也不知道…”

en: But he did not answer me. He said to me, instead:
cn: 但是，他不回答我，他对我说：

en: "You know-- my descent to the earth... Tomorrow will be its anniversary."
cn: “你知道，我落在地球上…到明天就一周年了…”

en: Then, after a silence, he went on:
cn: 接着，沉默了一会儿，他又说道：

en: "I came down very near here."
cn: “我就落在这附近…”

en: And he flushed.
cn: 此时，他的面颊绯红。

en: And once again, without understanding why, I had a queer sense of sorrow. One question, however, occurred to me:
cn: 我不知为什么，又感到一阵莫名其妙的心酸。这时，我产生了一个问题：

en: "Then it was not by chance that on the morning when I first met you-- a week ago-- you were strolling along like that, all alone, a thousand miles from any inhabited region? You were on the your back to the place where you landed?"
cn: “一星期以前，我认识你的那天早上，你单独一个人在这旷无人烟的地方走着；这么说，这并不是偶然的了？你是要回到你降落的地方去是吗！”

en: The little prince flushed again.
cn: 小王子的脸又红了。

en: And I added, with some hesitancy:
cn: 我犹豫不定地又说了一句：

en: "Perhaps it was because of the anniversary?"
cn: “可能是因为周年纪念吧？…”

en: The little prince flushed once more. He never answered questions-- but when one flushes does that not mean "Yes"?
cn: 小王子脸又红了。他从来也不回答这些问题，但是，脸红，就等于说“是的”，是吧？

en: "Ah," I said to him, "I am a little frightened--"
cn: “啊！”我对他说：“我有点怕…”

en: But he interrupted me.
cn: 但他却回答我说：

en: "Now you must work. You must return to your engine. I will be waiting for you here. Come back tomorrow evening..."
cn: “你现在该工作了。你应该回到你的机器那里去。我在这里等你。你明天晚上再来…”

en: But I was not reassured. I remembered the fox. One runs the risk of weeping a little, if one lets himself be tamed...
cn: 但是，我放心不下。我想起了狐狸的话。如果被人驯服了，就可能会要哭的…

en: - the little prince converses with the snake; the little prince consoles the narrator; the little prince returns to his planet

Beside the well there was the ruin of an old stone wall. When I came back from my work, the next evening, I saw from some distance away my little price sitting on top of a wall, with his feet dangling. And I heard him say:
cn: 在井旁边有一堵残缺的石墙。第二天晚上我工作回来的时候，我远远地看见了小王子耷拉着双腿坐在墙上。我听见他在说话：

en: "Then you don't remember. This is not the exact spot."
cn: “你怎么不记得了呢？”他说，“绝不是在这儿。”

en: Another voice must have answered him, for he replied to it:
cn: 大概还有另一个声音在回答他，因为他答着腔说道：

en: "Yes, yes! It is the right day, but this is not the place."
cn: “没错，没错，日子是对的；但地点不是这里…”

en: I continued my walk toward the wall. At no time did I see or hear anyone. The little prince, however, replied once again:
cn: 我继续朝墙走去。我还是看不到，也听不见任何别人。可是小王子又回答道：

en: "--Exactly. You will see where my track begins, in the sand. You have nothing to do but wait for me there. I shall be there tonight."
cn: “…那当然。你会在沙上看到我的脚印是从什么地方开始的。你在那里等着我就行了。今天夜里我去那里。”

en: I was only twenty metres from the wall, and I still saw nothing.
cn: 我离墙约有二十米远，可我依然什么也没有看见。

en: After a silence the little prince spoke again:
cn: 小王子沉默了一会又说：

en: "You have good poison? You are sure that it will not make me suffer too long?"
cn: “你的毒液管用吗？你保证不会使我长时间地痛苦吗？”

en: I stopped in my tracks, my heart torn asunder; but still I did not understand.
cn: 我焦虑地赶上前去，但我仍然不明白是怎么回事。

en: "Now go away," said the little prince. "I want to get down from the wall."
cn: “现在你去吧，我要下来了！…”小王子说。

en: I dropped my eyes, then, to the foot of the wall-- and I leaped into the air. There before me, facing the little prince, was one of those yellow snakes that take just thirty seconds to bring your life to an end. Even as I was digging into my pocked to get out my revolver I made a running step back. But, at the noise I made, the snake let himself flow easily across the sand like the dying spray of a fountain, and, in no apparent hurry, disappeared, with a light metallic sound, among the stones.
cn: 于是，我也朝墙脚下看去，我吓了一跳。就在那里，一条黄蛇直起身子冲着小王子。这种黄蛇半分钟就能结果你的性命。我一面赶紧掏口袋，拔出手枪，一面跑过去。可是一听到我的脚步声，蛇却象一股干涸了的水柱一样，慢慢钻进沙里去。它不慌不忙地在石头的缝隙中钻动着，发出轻轻的金属般的响声。

en: I reached the wall just in time to catch my little man in my arms; his face was white as snow.
cn: 我到达墙边的时候，正好把我的这位小王子接在我的怀抱中。他的脸色雪一样惨白。

en: "What does this mean?" I demanded. "Why are you talking with snakes?"
cn: “这是搞的什么名堂！你怎么竟然和蛇也谈起心来了！”我解开了他一直带着的金黄色的围脖。我用水渍湿了他的太阳穴，让他喝了点水。这时，我什么也不敢再问他。他严肃地看着我，用双臂搂着我的脖子。我感到他的心就象一只被枪弹击中而濒于死亡的鸟的心脏一样在跳动着。他对我说：

en: I had loosened the golden muffler that he always wore. I had moistened his temples, and had given him some water to drink. And now I did not dare ask him any more questions. He looked at me very gravely, and put his arms around my neck. I felt his heart beating like the heart of a dying bird, shot with someone's rifle...
cn: “我很高兴，你找到了你的机器所缺少的东西。你不久就可以回家去了…”

en: "I am glad that you have found what was the matter with your engine," he said. "Now you can go back home--"
cn: “你怎么知道的？”

en: "How do you know about that?"
cn: 我正是来告诉他，在没有任何希望的情况下，我成功地完成了修理工作。

en: I was just coming to tell him that my work had been successful, beyond anything that I had dared to hope.
cn: 他不回答我的问题，却接着说道：

en: He made no answer to my question, but he added:
cn: “我也一样，今天，要回家去了…”

en: "I, too, am going back home today..."
cn: 然后，他忧伤地说：

en: Then, sadly--
cn: “我回家要远得多…要难得多…”

en: "It is much farther... it is much more difficult..."
cn: 我清楚地感到发生了某种不寻常的事。我把他当作小孩一样紧紧抱在怀里，可是我感觉到他径直地向着一个无底深渊沉陷下去，我想法拉住他，却怎么也办不到…

en: I realised clearly that something extraordinary was happening. I was holding him close in my arms as if he were a little child; and yet it seemed to me that he was rushing headlong toward an abyss from which I could do nothing to restrain him...
cn: 他的眼神很严肃，望着遥远的地方。

en: His look was very serious, like some one lost far away.
cn: “我有你画的羊，羊的箱子和羊的嘴套子…”

en: "I have your sheep. And I have the sheep's box. And I have the muzzle..."
cn: 他带着忧伤的神情微笑了。

en: And he gave me a sad smile.
cn: 我等了很长时间，才觉得他身子渐渐暖和起来。

en: I waited a long time. I could see that he was reviving little by little.
cn: “小家伙，你受惊了…”

en: "Dear little man," I said to him, "you are afraid..."
cn: 他害怕了，这是无疑的！他却温柔地笑着说：

en: He was afraid, there was no doubt about that. But he laughed lightly.
cn: “今天晚上，我会怕得更厉害…”

en: "I shall be much more afraid this evening..."
cn: 我再度意识到要发生一件不可弥补的事。我觉得我的心一下子就凉了。这时我才明白：一想到再也不能听到这笑声，我就不能忍受。这笑声对我来说，就好象是沙漠中的甘泉一样。

en: Once again I felt myself frozen by the sense of something irreparable. And I knew that I could not bear the thought of never hearing that laughter any more. For me, it was like a spring of fresh water in the desert.
cn: “小家伙，我还想听你笑…”

en: "Little man," I said, "I want to hear you laugh again."
cn: 但他对我说：

en: But he said to me:
cn: “到今天夜里，正好是一年了。我的星球将正好处于我去年降落的那个地方的上空…”

en: "Tonight, it will be a year... my star, then, can be found right above the place where I came to the Earth, a year ago..."
cn: “小家伙，这蛇的事，约会的事，还有星星，这全是一场噩梦吧？”

en: "Little man," I said, "tell me that it is only a bad dream-- this affair of the snake, and the meeting-place, and the star..."
cn: 但他并不回答我的问题。他对我说：

en: But he did not answer my plea. He said to me, instead: "The thing that is important is the thing that is not seen..."
cn: “重要的事，是看不见的…”

en: "Yes, I know..."
cn: “当然…”

en: "It is just as it is with the flower. If you love a flower that lives on a star, it is sweet to look at the sky at night. All the stars are a-bloom with flowers..."
cn: “这就象花一样。如果你爱上了一朵生长在一颗星星上的花，那么夜间，你看着天空就感到甜蜜愉快。所有的星星上都好象开着花。”

en: "Yes, I know..."
cn: “当然…”

en: "It is just as it is with the water. Because of the pulley, and the rope, what you gave me to drink was like music. You remember-- how good it was."
cn: “这也就象水一样，由于那辘轳和绳子的缘故，你给我喝的井水好象音乐一样…你记得吗？…这水非常好喝…”

en: "Yes, I know..."
cn: “当然…”

en: "And at night you will look up at the stars. Where I live everything is so small that I cannot show you where my star is to be found. It is better, like that. My star will just be one of the stars, for you. And so you will love to watch all the stars in the heavens... they will all be your friends. And, besides, I am going to make you a present..."
cn: “夜晚，你抬头望着星星，我的那颗太小了，我无法给你指出我的那颗星星是在哪里。这样倒更好。你可以认为我的那颗星星就在这些星星之中。那么，所有的星星，你都会喜欢看的…这些星星都将成为你的朋友。而且，我还要给你一件礼物…”

en: He laughed again.
cn: 他又笑了。

en: "Ah, little prince, dear little prince! I love to hear that laughter!"
cn: “啊！小家伙，小家伙，我喜欢听你这笑声！”

en: "That is my present. Just that. It will be as it was when we drank the water..."
cn: “这正好是我给你的礼物，…这就好象水那样。”

en: "What are you trying to say?"
cn: “你说的是什么？”

en: "All men have the stars," he answered, "but they are not the same things for different people. For some, who are travelers, the stars are guides. For others they are no more than little lights in the sky. For others, who are scholars, they are problems . For my businessman they were wealth. But all these stars are silent. You-- you alone-- will have the stars as no one else has them--"
cn: “人们眼里的星星并不都一样。对旅行的人来说，星星是向导。对别的人来说，星星只是些小亮光。对另外一些学者来说，星星就是他们探讨的学问。对我所遇见的那个实业家来说，星星是金钱。但是，所有这些星星都不会说话。你呢，你的那些星星将是任何人都不曾有过的…”

en: "What are you trying to say?"
cn: “你说的是什么？”

en: "In one of the stars I shall be living. In one of them I shall be laughing. And so it will be as if all the stars were laughing, when you look at the sky at night... you-- only you-- will have stars that can laugh!"
cn: “夜晚，当你望着天空的时候，既然我就住在其中一颗星星上，既然我在其中一颗星星上笑着，那么对你来说，就好象所有的星星都在笑，那么你将看到的星星就是会笑的星星！”

en: And he laughed again.
cn: 这时，他又笑了。

en: "And when your sorrow is comforted (time soothes all sorrows) you will be content that you have known me. You will always be my friend. You will want to laugh with me. And you will sometimes open your window, so, for that pleasure... and your friends w ill be properly astonished to see you laughing as you look up at the sky! Then you will say to them, 'Yes, the stars always make me laugh!' And they will think you are crazy. It will be a very shabby trick that I shall have played on you..."
cn: “那么，在你得到了安慰之后（人们总是会自我安慰的）你就会因为认识了我而感到高兴。你将永远是我的朋友。你就会想要同我一起笑。有时，你会为了快乐而不知不觉地打开窗户。你的朋友们会奇怪地看着你笑着仰望天空。那时，你就可以对他们说：‘是的，星星总是引我欢笑！’他们会以为你发疯了。我的恶作剧将使你难堪…”

en: And he laughed again.
cn: 这时，他又笑了。

en: "It will be as if, in place of the stars, I had given you a great number of little bells that knew how to laugh..."
cn: “这就好象我并没有给你星星，而是给你一大堆会笑出声来的小铃铛…”

en: And he laughed again. Then he quickly became serious:
cn: 他仍然笑着。随后他变得严肃起来：

en: "Tonight-- you know... do not come," said the little prince.
cn: “今天夜里…你知道…不要来了。”

en: "I shall not leave you," I said.
cn: “我不离开你。”

en: "I shall look as if I were suffering. I shall look a little as if I were dying. It is like that. Do not come to see that. It is not worth the trouble..."
cn: “我将会象是很痛苦的样子…我有点象要死去似的。就是这么回事，你就别来看这些了，没有必要。”

en: "I shall not leave you."
cn: “我不离开你。”

en: But he was worried.
cn: 可是他担心起来。

en: "I tell you-- it is also because of the snake. He must not bite you. Snakes-- they are malicious creatures. This one might bite you just for fun..."
cn: “我对你说这些…这也是因为蛇的缘故。别让它咬了你…蛇是很坏的，它随意咬人…”

en: "I shall not leave you."
cn: “我不离开你。”

en: But a thought came to reassure him:
cn: 这时，他似乎有点放心了：

en: "It is true that they have no more poison for a second bite."
cn: “对了，它咬第二口的时候就没有毒液了…”

en: That night I did not see him set out on his way. He got away from me without making a sound. When I succeeded in catching up with him he was walking along with a quick and resolute step. He said to me merely:
cn: 这天夜里，我没有看到他起程。他不声不响地跑了。当我终于赶上他的时候，他坚定地快步走着。他只是对我说道：

en: "Ah! You are there..."
cn: “啊，你在这儿…”

en: And he took me by the hand. But he was still worrying.
cn: 于是他拉着我的手。但是他仍然很担心：

en: "It was wrong of you to come. You will suffer. I shall look as if I were dead; and that will not be true..."
cn: “你不该这样。你会难受的。我会象是死去的样子，但这不会是真的…”

en: I said nothing.
cn: 我默默无言。

en: "You understand... it is too far. I cannot carry this body with me. It is too heavy."
cn: “你明白，路很远。我不能带着这付身躯走。它太重了。”

en: I said nothing.
cn: 我依然沉默不语。

en: "But it will be like an old abandoned shell. There is nothing sad about old shells..."
cn: “但是，这就好象剥落的旧树皮一样。旧树皮，并没有什么可悲的。”

en: I said nothing.
cn: 我还是沉默不语。

en: He was a little discouraged. But he made one more effort:
cn: 他有些泄气了。但是他又振作起来：

en: "You know, it will be very nice. I, too, shall look at the stars. All the stars will be wells with a rusty pulley. All the stars will pour out fresh water for me to drink..."
cn: “这将是蛮好的，你知道。我也一定会看星星的。所有的星星都将是带有生了锈的辘轳的井。所有的星星都会倒水给我喝…”

en: I said nothing.
cn: 我还是沉默不语。

en: "That will be so amusing! You will have five hundred million little bells, and I shall have five hundred million springs of fresh water..."
cn: “这将是多么好玩啊！你将有五亿个铃铛，我将有五亿口水井…”

en: And he too said nothing more, becuase he was crying...
cn: 这时，他也沉默了，因为他在哭。

en: "Here it is. Let me go on by myself."
cn: “就是这儿。让我自个儿走一步吧。”

en: And he sat down, because he was afraid. Then he said, again:
cn: 他这时坐下来，因为他害怕了。他却仍然说道：

en: "You know-- my flower... I am responsible for her. And she is so weak! She is so naive! She has four thorns, of no use at all, to protect herself against all the world..."
cn: “你知道…我的花…我是要对她负责的！而她又是那么弱小！她又是那么天真。她只有四根微不足道的刺，保护自己，抵抗外敌…”

en: I too sat down, because I was not able to stand up any longer.
cn: 我也坐了下来，因为我再也站立不住了。他说道：

en: "There now-- that is all..."
cn: “就是这些…全都说啦…”

en: He still hesitated a little; then he got up. He took one step. I could not move.
cn: 他犹豫了一下，然后站起来。他迈出了一步。而我却动弹不得。

en: There was nothing but a flash of yellow close to his ankle. He remained motionless for an instant. He did not cry out. He fell as gently as a tree falls. There was not even any sound, because of the sand.
cn: 在他的脚踝子骨附近，一道黄光闪了一下。刹那间他一动也不动了。他没有叫喊。他轻轻地象一棵树一样倒在地上，大概由于沙地的缘故，连一点响声都没有。

en: - the narrator's afterthoughts
And now six years have already gone by...
cn: 到现在，一点不错，已经有六年了…

en: I have never yet told this story. The companions who met me on my return were well content to see me alive. I was sad, but I told them: "I am tired."
cn: 我还从未讲过这个故事。同伴们重新见到了我，都为能看见我活着回来而高兴。我却很悲伤。我告诉他们：“这是因为疲劳的缘故…”

en: Now my sorrow is comforted a little. That is to say-- not entirely. But I know that he did go back to his planet, because I did not find his body at daybreak. It was not such a heavy body... and at night I love to listen to the stars. It is like five hundred million little bells...
cn: 现在，我稍微得到了些安慰。就是说…还没有完全平静下来。可我知道他已经回到了他的星球上。因为那天黎明，我没有再见到他的身躯。他的身躯并不那么重…从此，我就喜欢在夜间倾听着星星，好象是倾听着五亿个铃铛…

en: But there is one extraordinary thing... when I drew the muzzle for the little prince, I forgot to add the leather strap to it. He will never have been able to fasten it on his sheep. So now I keep wondering: what is happening on his planet? Perhaps the sheep has eaten the flower...
cn: 可是，现在却又发生了不寻常的事。我给小王子画的羊嘴套上，忘了画皮带！他再也不可能把它套在羊嘴上。于是，我思忖着：“他的星球上发生了什么事呢？大概小羊把花吃掉了吧…”

en: At one time I say to myself: "Surely not! The little prince shuts his flower under her glass globe every night, and he watches over his sheep very carefully..." Then I am happy. And there is sweetness in the laughter of all the stars.
cn: 有时我又对自己说，“绝对不会的！小王子每天夜里都用玻璃罩子罩住他的花，而且他会把羊看管好的…”想到这里，我就非常高兴。这时，所有的星星都在柔情地轻声笑着。

en: But at another time I say to myself: "At some moment or other one is absent-minded, and that is enough! On some one evening he forgot the glass globe, or the sheep got out, without making any noise, in the night..." And then the little bells are changed to tears...
cn: 忽而我又对自己说：“人们有时总免不了会疏忽的，那就够戗！某一天晚上他忘了玻璃罩子，或者小羊夜里不声不响地跑出来…”想到这里，小铃铛都变成泪珠了！

en: Here, then, is a great mystery. For you who also love the little prince, and for me, nothing in the universe can be the same if somewhere, we do not know where, a sheep that we never saw has-- yes or no?-- eaten a rose...
cn: 这真是一个很大的奥秘。对你们这些喜欢小王子的人来说，就象对于我来说一样，无论什么地方，凡是某处，如果一只羊（尽管我们并不认识它），吃了一朵玫瑰花，或是没有吃掉一朵玫瑰花，那么宇宙的面貌就全然不同。

en: Look up at the sky. Ask yourselves: is it yes or no? Has the sheep eaten the flower? And you will see how everything changes...
cn: 你们望着天空。你们想一想：羊究竟是吃了还是没有吃掉花？那么你们就会看到一切都变了样…

en: And no grown-up will ever understand that this is a matter of so much importance!
cn: 任何一个大人将永远不会明白这个问题竟如此重要！

en: This is, to me, the loveliest and saddest landscape in the world. It is the same as that on the preceding page, but I have drawn it again to impress it on your memory. It is here that the little prince appeared on Earth, and disappeared.
cn: 对我来说，这是全世界最可爱，也最悲伤的景象。这和前一页的景色相同，但是我要再画一次，来加深你的印象。 这就是小王子从地球上出现和消失的地方。

en: Look at it carefully so that you will be sure to recognise it in case you travel some day to the African desert. And, if you should come upon this spot, please do not hurry on. Wait for a time, exactly under the star. Then, if a little man appears who laughs, who has golden hair and who refuses to answer questions, you will know who he is. If this should happen, please comfort me. Send me word that he has come back.
cn: 仔细看看它，以备将来去非洲的沙漠旅行时，你就一定能认出它来。如果你经过这里，请不要匆匆离开。在星空下，停留片刻。如果有个笑着的，满头金发的，拒绝回答问题的小家伙出现了，你很清楚他是谁。如果这发生了，请来安慰我。 写信告诉我，他回来了。
